title: Macy's to hire 80,000 seasonal employees, the same as last year
text: Macy's Inc. M, +1.02% said Thursday it plans to hire 80,000 seasonal employees for the holidays, the same as in 2018. The department store chain will hold hiring events on Oct. 24 at all of its stores, call centers and distribution and fulfillment centers. Included in the hiring plan is 30,000 employees based in fulfillment facilities, up 6,500 from last year. "Macy's, Inc. is offering full-time, part-time and flexible positions in anticipation of a busy holiday shopping season," the company said in a statement. In 2018, the company said more than 8,000 of the seasonal hires, or about 27%, received permanent positions after the holiday season. The stock, which slipped 0.3% in premarket trading, has plunged 50.8% year to date through Wednesday, while the SPDR S&P Retail ETF XRT, +0.29% has inched up less than 0.1% and the S&P 500 SPX, +0.80% has gained 15.2%.
